poem:
### In the Haze of Conflict

The sparrows sing despite the guns, 
in fields where blood and soil mix true,
unbowed stalks of grain bend low—
Ukraine, with memories of frost,
owns the dawn; Russia, the dusk.
Peace, a distant specter cloaked in 
shades of grieving ash and suns,
weighs heavy on the hearts of men.
